quest.name: Where Everything Begins
journal: The dark-robed voidsent regards you questioningly.

The dark-robed voidsent is willing to provide you with the information you seek─for a price. In this world, she explains, no one aids another unless they themselves stand to gain. The bargain is struck with an offer of aether, and you make your way outside the dungeon for a lesson on the void.

There was once Light here in the Thirteenth, but a terrible conflict known as the Contramemoria shattered the balance of aether, causing Darkness to engulf the world. Thus was all life transformed into voidsent. The dark-robed voidsent, however, is voidsent only in part, on account of having been touched by Darkness while still in her mother's womb, when the war had only just begun. Desiring a name by which to call her, Y'shtola suggests “Zero”─which the half-voidsent woman accepts with the disinterest of the damned.
Believing yourselves exposed, Varshahn suggests continuing the conversation inside the castle. Thus do you make your way to the throne room.

On arriving at the throne room, Zero demands her payment. But ere Y'shtola can provide it, Scarmiglione, whom you had believed slain, sets upon you once more. The archfiend reveals that death doesn't exist in the void, and you struggle to contend with his powers of regeneration─until Zero agrees to join the fray. All marvel as she uses her mysterious power to transform Scarmiglione's minions into crystals. With the odds made even, you turn to deal with the archfiend himself.

You succeed in overcoming Scarmiglione, with Zero delivering the coup de grâce and binding him in crystal. Taking the object in your hand, you experience a vision of the past─of a knight in black named Golbez, and those he proclaimed his four archfiends. Of greater interest, however, is the presence of what appears to be a wyrm...

From the memoria crystals and their part in the world-ending war to Golbez and his mysterious ambitions, you have been given much to consider─and doubtless have many new questions. Fortunately, as Y'shtola observes, Zero still owes you some few answers.
objectives: Speak with Zero in the Seat of the Foremost.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: While the language of this world is similar to ours, it is her covenant with Zenos that should ensure we can understand one another.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The magick for summoning voidsent also facilitates communication, you see. Without this component, a mage would struggle to make his mind known to his servant.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Zenos's avatar, eh? What are the odds.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: We still know little about her, but for now I'm glad we found someone who can do more than moan for aether.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I assume the dungeon was reserved for those intended for the mistress's consumption.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: 'Tis fortunate that we came here when we did. Fateful, even.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: So, I doubt you came to the dungeon by pure chance. What is it that you're after?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: We were looking for a voidsent with whom we could converse, in the course of which we learned of you.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: We are visitors to this world, and know little and less of its workings and ways.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: We would be grateful if you could tell us about it. About yourself.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: So it's information you seek.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: What do you offer for it?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: ...I beg your pardon?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Voidsent do not give unless we stand to gain.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: If you desire something, you pay the price. That is the sole rule in this world you call the void.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: That makes sense. Pray forgive our ignorance.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: But what would be acceptable as payment? I suspect that such coin as we carry has no value here.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Voidsent crave one thing alone: aether.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: In return for information, I offer you mine. Just not all of it, mind you. I still have need of my life.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Very well. I will tell you no more than you can afford to pay.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Then we have a bargain.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: If we're to talk about the void, let us do so outside. Come with me.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You needn't worry for me. My life force is a small price to pay for her knowledge, and I will recover it quickly enough once we've returned home.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Their “one rule” is no different from that of many in our own world.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It's those like Alphinaud who are a rare breed.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: We cannot allow Y'shtola to bear the burden alone. When next the opportunity arises, I will offer my own aether.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: No one else seems to be nearby. Perhaps it was just a trick of the wind...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If naught is out of the ordinary, I should like to hear more from Zero. I can't imagine there are many part voidsent like her who remember the world as it was.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: We may have subdued the voidsent here, but I doubt they'll remain that way. Remain vigilant.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: “Beginning”... A curious notion in a world where all has come to an end.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I must say, we are rather exposed here.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Perhaps we should continue the conversation within the castle.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: The throne room is defensible, given its few points of ingress. Let us head back there.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Moving wasn't part of the bargain. I'll comply, but I expect my payment promptly.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You shall have it as soon as we've arrived.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I will see to the payment, and then we may ask Zero what she knows about Azdaja.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I feel eyes on us. Stay alert.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: All appears unchanged here.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Upon proceeding, several cutscenes will play in sequence.
It is recommended that you set aside sufficient time to view these scenes in their entirety.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In addition, you will be required to participate in battle. Your progress will be saved at certain points. In the event that you are defeated, you will be able to try again from the most recent of these.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that if you enter battles associated with other quests or log out from the game, this progress will be lost.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must be a Disciple of War or Magic of level 90 or above to proceed.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: We've vanquished one of Golbez's archfiends, but three remain. As troublesome as this one, I expect.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: If Golbez has Azdaja at his mercy, then we must find him. Hopefully Zero has knowledge that will aid us in our search...

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: There is nothing like the aether of a living mortal. I haven't felt so satisfied since my return.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: In light of our recent experiences, I expect we all have questions. I trust Zero can answer some few of them.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We should still be owed at least that much, I daresay.
